title.native: アイドリッシュセブン Second BEAT!

description:
The second season of IDOLiSH7.

Note: The first episode received a special screening at "Idolish 7 Fan Thanksgiving Day vol.5" on December 14, 2019 and it was distributed on various streaming websites on January 7, 2020. The regular TV broadcast started on April 5, 2020.
synonyms: ไอดอลิช 7 เซคันด์ บีท!

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/739726003056955393)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/4_7t)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

**Doujin Circle:** Meguro Teikoku (目黒帝国, with [Meguro](https://anilist.co/staff/150816/Meguro)), Strawberry Lunch (with [Ai Minase](https://anilist.co/staff/100342/Ai-Minase))

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/arinacchi) | [Website](http://tanemuraarina.com/)

Arina Tanemura likes Japanese pop music very much (especially [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto), Aya Matsuura and the all-girl, [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/Morning-Musume)) and she loves the game series Final Fantasy. She has one elder and one younger sister and one brother. She hates to lose (in every point of view) and she loves the Margaret Magazine of Shueisha. She says that she is too fat and that she dislikes her face. She has two cats named Riku and Kai, and at Tanemura's homepage you can find many photos of them. She wants to draw like no-one else (she can't lose...) and she loves to go to karaoke with her assistants (friends). She is good friends with the manga-ka [Ryo Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/98904/Ryo-Maekawa) and [Ruka Kazuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100291/Ruka-Kazuki).

She's not really a fan of yaoi (boys' love) manga, but she has made a yaoi doujinshi (no specified title) for one of her friends. She has also made a few adults-only comics on Full Moon wo Sagashite and Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne.

Her nicknames include the sobriquets "Arinacchi" and "Arinaccho" (Arinaccho is a humorous play on Arinacchi, and was said just because of the ridiculousness of it all).

Arina participated in Shinshi Doumei Cross drama CDs as [Yoshitaka Ichinomiya](https://anilist.co/character/3507/Yoshitaka-Ichinomiya) and Postman.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.
[Official Website](https://tsmbnt.wixsite.com/entak) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bunta_hard)

They are handled by the Okazaki Agency with [Rinto Okazaki](https://anilist.co/character/192988/) being their manager.

node.description:
[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/11h1iiNftmZ7WB33TYOwXH)

TRIGGER is a 3 member idol group from the Japanese rhythm game 'Idolish7'. The game later received it's own anime adaptation and manga, which the group TRIGGER and it's individual members have made multiple appearances. Their names contain numbers 8~10 in kanji. Their music symbols mainly consist of clefs.

The members consist of the leader of the group [Gaku Yaotome](https://anilist.co/character/126250) voiced by Wataru Hatano, their center [Tenn Kujo](https://anilist.co/character/89894) voiced by Souma Saito, and [Ryuunosuke Tsunashi](https://anilist.co/character/126249) voiced by Takuya Satou.

In the game they are signed under Yaotome Production Company, an in game record label and entertainment company. Their manager is [Kaoru Anesagi](https://anilist.co/character/190928/) voiced by [Yoshihisa Kawahara](https://anilist.co/staff/95409/).

[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/11h1iiNftmZ7WB33TYOwXH)

TRIGGER is a 3 member idol group from the Japanese rhythm game 'Idolish7'. The game later received it's own anime adaptation and manga, which the group TRIGGER and it's individual members have made multiple appearances. Their names contain numbers 8~10 in kanji. Their music symbols mainly consist of clefs.

The members consist of the leader of the group [Gaku Yaotome](https://anilist.co/character/126250) voiced by Wataru Hatano, their center [Tenn Kujo](https://anilist.co/character/89894) voiced by Souma Saito, and [Ryuunosuke Tsunashi](https://anilist.co/character/126249) voiced by Takuya Satou.

In the game they are signed under Yaotome Production Company, an in game record label and entertainment company. Their manager is [Kaoru Anesagi](https://anilist.co/character/190928/) voiced by [Yoshihisa Kawahara](https://anilist.co/staff/95409/).

[Profile](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/hidakarina/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidaka_rina0615) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rina_hidaka615)

She announced on her Twitter account that she married the voice actor [Yuuma Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/119617) on January 1st, 2024.

**Non-Anime Roles**:
• Miyako Sakuma - Kirisame ga Furu Mori (Drama CD)
• Clara - Honkai: Star Rail
• Neon - Goddess of Victory: Nikke

**[Website](http://www.yumanabe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/YuManabe)**

Japanese violinist. Leader of the strings ensemble [Yuu Manabe Strings](https://anilist.co/staff/163836/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kz_lt)__

kz (pronounced "k-zet") (also known as RE:NDZ) is one of the early authors of Hatsune Miku songs, and most of his works have become hits, starting with his debut, "Packaged." He is skilled at creating reverberant, technopop pieces with Hatsune Miku. Though he has not been active on Nico Nico Douga since late 2008, he did create the new songs "Far Away" and "Star Story" for the release of the July 2009 Sony PSP game "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA", and it's July 29, 2010 sequel "Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA 2nd".  kz is the sole member of the amateur music circle livetune who, in late 2007, released an a Vocaloid album titled "Re:package" at Comic Market 73. It was then resold by Victor Entertainment with a major circulation release on August 28, 2008, making it the first Hatsune Miku CD to be sold by a major label.   livetune was originally a 2 member unit, made up by kz and kajyuki. However, kajyuki left in 2008 to work at CAPCOM, leaving kz as the only member.

__Real name:__ Asuka Kato (加藤あすか)

[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/yuuki_aira/)

A J pop singer attached to the company Lantis. She began her career in 2007 performing in [Yuki Kajura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077)'s [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) as "FictionJunction ASUKA". She released her debut album- Reflection on July 2, 2008.

Non-anime roles:
Hom-kun in "Atelier Meruru" (VG) (Japanese)
Theme Song Performance (OP/ED) for "Root Double -Before Crime * After Days-" (Visual novel) (Japanese)
